definition: and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: With softness and strength, i would like to make more friends.
sentences.chinese: 我刚柔并济，活泼大方，愿意结交更多的朋友。

sentences.english: This is a kind of flexible management mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种刚柔并济的灵活性的管理机制。

sentences.english: The usage of the steel and wood gives the feeling of hard and soft.
sentences.chinese: 钢铁和木材的使用将刚柔并济的感觉结合起来。

definition: to use softness to conquer strength (idiom)
soft on the inside despite one's hard shell/appearing tough on the outside as to mask one's inner vulnerability/also written 內柔外剛|内柔外刚[nei4 rou2 wai4 gang1]
(of a person) beautiful inside and out
lit. the soft can subdue the hard
to display (one's potential, one's talents etc)
lit. a needle concealed in silk floss (idiom)/fig. ruthless character behind a gentle appearance/a wolf in sheep's clothing/an iron fist in a velvet glove
